newsitem.title: USA: Pacific Exchange trades record volume on July 18.
newsitem.headline: Pacific Exchange trades record volume on July 18.

text.p: The Pacific Exchange (PCX) said its equity options products traded a record 354,000 contracts on Friday, July 18, capping a record week in which 1,510,613 contracts changed hands.

The exchange said the record daily volume, set at the end of the July option expiration week, surpassed the previous peak of 324,700 contracts set on April 18, 1997. The previous weekly record of 1,115,007 lots was set in January, 1997.
Turnover through the first two quarters of the year had risen 22.99 percent from a year earlier to 20,906,086 contracts, PCX added.
